name: RND_01

name: PS_A_Medicaid_Bi
description: [I favor expanding Medicaid insurance benefits for low income families to provide coverage for treatment of opioid use disorders/addiction problems, including addiction to prescription pain medications. ] Do you disagree or agree with the following stateme

name: PS_B_Naloxone_Bi
description: [I favor making naloxone (also known as 'Narcan'), a medication that can quickly reverse the effects of a person experiencing an opioid overdose, widely available and affordable without a prescription.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statement

name: PS_C_Mandatory_Bi
description: [I believe that making drug treatment mandatory is an effective way to help people with an opioid use disorder.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: PS_D_GovSpend_Bi
description: [I favor increasing government spending to improve treatment of opioid use disorder/addiction.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: DS_E_Schools_Bi
description: [High schools and colleges should be allowed to dismiss or expel a person with an opioid use disorder/addiction.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: DS_F_Physicians_Bi
description: [Physicians and other healthcare providers should be allowed to refuse to treat a person with an opioid use disorder/addiction.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: DS_G_Employers_Bi
description: [Employers should be allowed to deny employment to a person with a current opioid use disorder/addiction.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: DS_H_Landlords_Bi
description: [Landlords should be allowed to deny housing to a person with a current opioid use disorder/addiction.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: PS_I_SeekMedical_Bi
description: [I favor passing laws to protect people from criminal charges for drug crimes if they seek medical help for experiencing an opioid/prescription pain medication problem.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: PS_J_JailHealth_Bi
description: [I believe that incarceration/jail is an effective way to improve the health of people with an opioid use disorder.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: PS_K_JailOverdose_Bi
description: [I believe that incarceration/jail is an effective way to reduce the risk of overdosing for people with an opioid use disorder.] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: PS_L_JailTreatment_Bi
description: [I believe that people in jail/prison with an opioid use disorder/addiction problem should get access to medication for opioid use disorder (e.g., methadone, buprenorphine, or naltrexone).] Do you disagree or agree with the following statements?

name: KB_A_Definition_Bi
description: [Opioid addiction is defined by a person continuing to use opioids despite negative consequences.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_B_AnyUse_Bi
description: [Anyone who uses opioids long-term for pain has an opioid addiction.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_C_SelfControl_Bi
description: [Most people who develop and/or struggle with opioid use disorder/addiction lack self-control.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_D_MoralFail_Bi
description: [Misuse of opioids is a moral failing.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_E_QuitAnytime_Bi
description: [A person struggling with opioid use disorder/addiction can quit using anytime if they choose.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_F_StopBreathing_Bi
description: [When misused, opioids can slow your breathing or even cause you to stop breathing entirely and lead to an overdose or death.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_G_Recover_Bi
description: [Evidence-based treatments for opioid use disorder can recover people from opioid addiction.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_H_MedicalCondition_Bi
description: [Opioid use disorder is a medical condition like other chronic health conditions.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_I_RockBottom_Bi
description: [A person struggling with opioid use disorder/addiction must hit rock bottom before they are ready to accept treatment.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_J_EasyFind_Bi
description: [It is easy to find good opioid use disorder treatment.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_K_FDA_Bi
description: [The FDA has approved medications that are effective in treating opioid use disorder/addiction.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_L_JailHelps_Bi
description: [Jailing someone with an opioid use disorder for at least a few days will help them by reducing their risk for an overdose.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_M_MedHoax_Bi
description: [Medication for opioid use disorder (e.g., methadone, buprenorphine, or naltrexone) is a hoax.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_N_MedAbuse_Bi
description: [Medication for opioid use disorder (e.g., methadone, buprenorphine/suboxone, or naltrexone/vivitrol) is just substituting one form of drug abuse for another type of drug abuse.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opio

name: KB_O_LongTerm_Bi
description: [People with an opioid use disorder/addiction need long-term treatment with medications.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: KB_P_Responsible_Bi
description: [People who misuse opioids can function as responsible members of society.] Answer whether you disagree or agree with the following statements about opioid use disorder/addiction.

name: Stigma_Scale_Score
description: Stigma scale: average score of 6 stigma items; higher scores indicate higher stigma.

name: KB_B_AnyUse_Correct
description: Anyone who uses opioids long-term for pain has an opioid addiction [False]: disagreement coded as "correct"

name: KB_E_QuitAnytime_Correct
description: A person struggling with opioid use disorder/addiction can quit using anytime if they choose [False]: disagreement coded as "correct"

name: KB_I_RockBottom_Correct
description: A person struggling with opioid use disorder/addiction must hit rock bottom before they are ready to accept treatment [False]: disagreement coded as "correct"

name: KB_J_EasyFind_Correct
description: It is easy to find good opioid use disorder treatment [False]: disagreement coded as "correct"

name: KB_N_MedAbuse_Correct
description: Medication for opioid use disorder (e.g., methadone, buprenorphine/suboxone, or naltrexone/vivitrol) is just substituting one form of drug abuse for another type of drug abuse [False]: disagreement coded as "correct"

name: KB_A_Definition_Correct
description: Opioid addiction is defined by a person continuing to use opioids despite negative consequences [True]: agreement coded as correct

name: KB_F_StopBreathing_Correct
description: When misused, opioids can slow your breathing or even cause you to stop breathing entirely and lead to an overdose or death [True]: agreement coded as correct

name: KB_G_Recover_Correct
description: Evidence-based treatments for opioid use disorder can recover people from opioid addiction [True]: agreement coded as correct

name: KB_H_MedicalCondition_Correct
description: Opioid use disorder is a medical condition like other chronic health conditions [True]: agreement coded as correct

name: KB_K_FDA_Correct
description: The FDA has approved medications that are effective in treating opioid use disorder/addiction [True]: agreement coded as correct

name: Policy_Attitudes_Scale
description: Policy attitudes scale score from average of eight items. Higher scores indicate more support for policies benefitting those with OUD.

name: Discrimination_Scale_Score
description: Acceptance of discrimination scale score from average of four items. Higher scores indicate more acceptance of discrimination.

name: KnowledgeScore_new
description: Sum of 10 knowledge-based items, with higher scores indicating more knowledge.

name: Criminality_Scale_Score
description: Perceptions of criminality scale score. Average of five items with higher scores indicating more perceived criminality toward those with OUD.
